info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Neches River At Rockland affecting Jasper, Angelina and Tyler Counties.
For the Neches River...including Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Neches River at Rockland.
* WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning and continue rising to 26.6 feet early Sunday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 745 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Angelina, TX; Jasper, TX; Tyler, TX
